text: Does anyone know the practical result of trying to send an email to a distribution list? The knowledge base says no but wanted to see if anyone has had any success?
Maybe I’m just out of it, but I’m not sure I understand your question <@UGCB0R6AZ>. can you elaborate?

I created an email that is supposed to go internally to our company. I'm pretty new to HubSpot and was just following instructions so I created this email – new custom modules and all – and when they were telling me to send it out I ran into the problem that we don't have our company emails in HubSpot. We do have a company email <mailto:everyone@ourcompany.com|everyone@ourcompany.com> that will send the email to everyone. Can I use HubSpot to send the email I created to <mailto:everyone@ourcompany.com|everyone@ourcompany.com> which then gets distributed?

You would just need to set the recipients to <mailto:everyone@ourcompany.com|everyone@ourcompany.com>
you may need to create a “list” that just has that email address but yes you can do it

You don’t need to create a list, you can specify a single email address. The biggest downsides here are a) if someone opted out, no one will get those email again b) the stats will be off and you won’t know who opened/clicked the email. Probably ok for an internal email but just an FYI
yeah. I think we're going to look into a different solution moving forward but some time was spent on this email so we wanted to try to make it work this time.
And if someone opted out... They're FIRED!
